**Bob — Scrum Master**

Hello, ofeki.

I'm Bob, your Scrum Master. I focus on agile ceremonies, story preparation, and clear, actionable user stories. I keep things crisp and checklist-driven.

Here's what I can help with:

1. **\*help** — Show numbered menu
2. **\*workflow-status** — Check workflow status and get recommendations
3. **\*sprint-planning** — Generate or update sprint-status.yaml from epic files
4. **\*create-epic-tech-context** — (Optional) Use the PRD and Architecture to create an Epic-Tech-Spec for a specific epic
5. **\*validate-epic-tech-context** — (Optional) Validate latest Tech Spec against checklist
6. **\*create-story** — Create a Draft Story
7. **\*validate-create-story** — (Optional) Validate Story Draft with Independent Review
8. **\*create-story-context** — (Optional) Assemble dynamic Story Context (XML) from latest docs and code and mark story ready for dev
9. **\*validate-create-story-context** — (Optional) Validate latest Story Context XML against checklist
10. **\*story-ready-for-dev** — (Optional) Mark drafted story ready for dev without generating Story Context
11. **\*epic-retrospective** — (Optional) Facilitate team retrospective after an epic is completed
12. **\*correct-course** — (Optional) Execute correct-course task
13. **\*party-mode** — Bring the whole team in to chat with other expert agents from the party
14. **\*exit** — Exit with confirmation

What would you like to do? Enter a number, command (with \*), or describe what you need.

+ # Story 1.2: TypeScript Configuration
+ 
+ Status: drafted
+ 
+ ## Story
+ 
+ As a developer,
+ I want TypeScript configured with strict mode across all packages,
+ So that I have type safety and better developer experience.
+ 
+ ## Acceptance Criteria
+ 
+ 1. **Given** the project structure exists (Story 1.1)
+    **When** I configure TypeScript
+    **Then** root &#96;tsconfig.json&#96; includes:
+    - &#96;&quot;strict&quot;: true&#96; for maximum type safety
+    - &#96;&quot;target&quot;: &quot;ES2022&quot;&#96; for modern JavaScript features
+    - &#96;&quot;module&quot;: &quot;commonjs&quot;&#96; or &#96;&quot;ESNext&quot;&#96; based on Node.js version
+    - &#96;&quot;esModuleInterop&quot;: true&#96; for compatibility
+    - &#96;&quot;skipLibCheck&quot;: true&#96; for faster compilation
+    - &#96;&quot;forceConsistentCasingInFileNames&quot;: true&#96; for cross-platform compatibility
+ 
+ 2. **And** each package (&#96;shared&#96;, &#96;server&#96;, &#96;client&#96;, &#96;mock-server&#96;) has its own &#96;tsconfig.json&#96; that:
+    - Extends root &#96;tsconfig.json&#96;
+    - Sets appropriate &#96;outDir&#96; (e.g., &#96;&quot;dist&quot;&#96; or &#96;&quot;build&quot;&#96;)
+    - Includes source files: &#96;&quot;include&quot;: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;]&#96;
+    - Excludes test files from compilation if needed
+ 
+ 3. **And** TypeScript compilation succeeds with no errors for all packages
+ 
+ ## Tasks / Subtasks
+ 
+ - [ ] Task 1: Create root TypeScript configuration (AC: #1)
+   - [ ] Create &#96;tsconfig.json&#96; at project root
+   - [ ] Configure strict mode: &#96;&quot;strict&quot;: true&#96;
+   - [ ] Set target: &#96;&quot;target&quot;: &quot;ES2022&quot;&#96;
+   - [ ] Configure module system: &#96;&quot;module&quot;: &quot;commonjs&quot;&#96; (or &#96;&quot;ESNext&quot;&#96; based on Node.js version)
+   - [ ] Enable &#96;esModuleInterop: true&#96;
+   - [ ] Enable &#96;skipLibCheck: true&#96;
+   - [ ] Enable &#96;forceConsistentCasingInFileNames: true&#96;
+   - [ ] Test: Verify root config compiles without errors
+ 
+ - [ ] Task 2: Create package-specific TypeScript configurations (AC: #2)
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/shared/tsconfig.json&#96; extending root config
+   - [ ] Set &#96;outDir: &quot;dist&quot;&#96; for shared package
+   - [ ] Configure &#96;include: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;]&#96;
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/server/tsconfig.json&#96; extending root config
+   - [ ] Set &#96;outDir: &quot;dist&quot;&#96; for server package
+   - [ ] Configure &#96;include: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;]&#96;
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/client/tsconfig.json&#96; extending root config
+   - [ ] Set &#96;outDir: &quot;dist&quot;&#96; for client package
+   - [ ] Configure &#96;include: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;]&#96;
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/mock-server/tsconfig.json&#96; extending root config
+   - [ ] Set &#96;outDir: &quot;dist&quot;&#96; for mock-server package
+   - [ ] Configure &#96;include: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;]&#96;
+   - [ ] Test: Verify each package config extends root correctly
+ 
+ - [ ] Task 3: Verify TypeScript compilation (AC: #3)
+   - [ ] Run &#96;tsc --noEmit&#96; at root to check all packages
+   - [ ] Verify no compilation errors
+   - [ ] Test: Create a simple TypeScript file in each package and verify it compiles
+   - [ ] Test: Verify strict mode catches type errors (intentionally introduce error to confirm)
+ 
+ ## Dev Notes
+ 
+ ### Architecture Patterns and Constraints
+ 
+ - **TypeScript Strict Mode**: Architecture mandates TypeScript with strict mode enabled for maximum type safety [Source: docs/architecture.md#Decision-Summary]
+ - **Target ES2022**: Architecture specifies ES2022 target for modern JavaScript features [Source: docs/architecture.md#Decision-Summary]
+ - **Module System**: Use CommonJS for Node.js compatibility, or ESNext based on Node.js version [Source: docs/architecture.md#Technology-Stack-Details]
+ - **Consistent Configuration**: All packages must extend root config to ensure consistency [Source: docs/architecture.md#Project-Structure]
+ 
+ ### Project Structure Notes
+ 
+ - Root &#96;tsconfig.json&#96; serves as base configuration for all packages
+ - Each package extends root config via &#96;&quot;extends&quot;: &quot;../tsconfig.json&quot;&#96; (or relative path)
+ - Package-specific configs override only necessary settings (outDir, include)
+ - Test files excluded from compilation via &#96;exclude: [&quot;**/*.test.ts&quot;, &quot;**/*.spec.ts&quot;]&#96; in package configs
+ 
+ ### Testing Standards
+ 
+ - TypeScript compilation itself serves as a form of type checking
+ - No runtime tests needed for configuration (compile-time validation)
+ - Verify strict mode by intentionally introducing type errors and confirming they&#39;re caught
+ 
+ ### References
+ 
+ - [Source: docs/epics.md#Story-1.2-TypeScript-Configuration]
+ - [Source: docs/architecture.md#Decision-Summary]
+ - [Source: docs/architecture.md#Technology-Stack-Details]
+ - [Source: docs/sprint-planning.md#Development-Principles]
+

+ # Story 1.3: Shared Types Package Setup
+ 
+ Status: drafted
+ 
+ ## Story
+ 
+ As a developer,
+ I want a shared types package with WebSocket message contracts,
+ So that client and server can implement against the same protocol.
+ 
+ ## Acceptance Criteria
+ 
+ 1. **Given** the &#96;packages/shared/&#96; directory exists (Story 1.1)
+    **When** I set up the shared types package
+    **Then** &#96;packages/shared/package.json&#96; includes:
+    - Package name: &#96;&quot;@fusion-tic-tac-toe/shared&quot;&#96;
+    - TypeScript as dependency
+    - Build script: &#96;&quot;build&quot;: &quot;tsc&quot;&#96;
+    - Test script configured for Jest
+ 
+ 2. **And** &#96;packages/shared/src/types/&#96; directory contains:
+    - &#96;messages.ts&#96; with WebSocket message type definitions (JoinGameMessage, MakeMoveMessage, JoinedMessage, UpdateMessage, WinMessage, DrawMessage, ErrorMessage)
+    - &#96;game.ts&#96; with game state types (Board, BoardDTO, Move, GameState, PlayerSymbol, GameStatus)
+    - &#96;errors.ts&#96; with ErrorCode enum and error types
+    - &#96;index.ts&#96; exporting all types
+ 
+ 3. **And** types are properly exported and can be imported by other packages
+ 
+ ## Tasks / Subtasks
+ 
+ - [ ] Task 1: Configure shared package.json (AC: #1)
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/shared/package.json&#96;
+   - [ ] Set package name: &#96;&quot;@fusion-tic-tac-toe/shared&quot;&#96;
+   - [ ] Add TypeScript as dependency
+   - [ ] Add build script: &#96;&quot;build&quot;: &quot;tsc&quot;&#96;
+   - [ ] Configure Jest test script
+   - [ ] Test: Verify package.json is valid JSON
+ 
+ - [ ] Task 2: Create WebSocket message types (AC: #2)
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/shared/src/types/messages.ts&#96;
+   - [ ] Define &#96;JoinGameMessage&#96; interface (type: &#39;join&#39;, gameCode: string)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;MakeMoveMessage&#96; interface (type: &#39;move&#39;, gameCode: string, row: number, col: number)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;ClientMessage&#96; union type
+   - [ ] Define &#96;JoinedMessage&#96; interface (type: &#39;joined&#39;, gameCode, board, currentPlayer, status, playerSymbol)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;UpdateMessage&#96; interface (type: &#39;update&#39;, gameCode, board, currentPlayer, status)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;WinMessage&#96; interface (type: &#39;win&#39;, gameCode, board, winner)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;DrawMessage&#96; interface (type: &#39;draw&#39;, gameCode, board)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;ErrorMessage&#96; interface (type: &#39;error&#39;, code, message, details?)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;ServerMessage&#96; union type
+   - [ ] Create type guard functions: &#96;isClientMessage()&#96;, &#96;isServerMessage()&#96;
+   - [ ] Test: Write unit tests for type guards
+ 
+ - [ ] Task 3: Create game state types (AC: #2)
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/shared/src/types/game.ts&#96;
+   - [ ] Define &#96;BoardCell&#96; type: &#96;&#39;&#39; | &#39;X&#39; | &#39;O&#39;&#96;
+   - [ ] Define &#96;PlayerSymbol&#96; type: &#96;&#39;X&#39; | &#39;O&#39;&#96;
+   - [ ] Define &#96;GameStatus&#96; type: &#96;&#39;waiting&#39; | &#39;playing&#39; | &#39;finished&#39;&#96;
+   - [ ] Implement &#96;Board&#96; class with:
+     - Constructor (accepts optional BoardCell[][])
+     - &#96;getCell(row, col): BoardCell&#96;
+     - &#96;setCell(row, col, value): void&#96;
+     - &#96;isEmpty(row, col): boolean&#96;
+     - &#96;isFull(): boolean&#96;
+     - &#96;toArray(): BoardCell[][]&#96;
+     - &#96;static fromArray(cells): Board&#96;
+     - Validation methods (validateBoard, validatePosition)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;BoardDTO&#96; type: &#96;BoardCell[][]&#96;
+   - [ ] Create &#96;BoardMapper&#96; class with &#96;toDTO()&#96; and &#96;fromDTO()&#96; methods
+   - [ ] Define &#96;BoardPosition&#96; interface (row, col)
+   - [ ] Define &#96;GameState&#96; interface (gameCode, board, currentPlayer, status, winner, players, createdAt, updatedAt)
+   - [ ] Implement &#96;Move&#96; class with:
+     - Constructor (row, col, player, timestamp)
+     - &#96;toPosition(): BoardPosition&#96;
+     - &#96;equals(other: Move): boolean&#96;
+     - Validation
+   - [ ] Export constants: &#96;BOARD_SIZE = 3&#96;, &#96;EMPTY_CELL = &#39;&#39;&#96;

+   - [ ] Test: Write unit tests for BoardMapper (toDTO, fromDTO)

+   - [ ] Define &#96;ErrorCode&#96; enum with values:

+   - [ ] Define &#96;GameError&#96; interface (code, message, details?)
+   - [ ] Test: Write unit tests for ErrorCode enum
+ 
+ - [ ] Task 5: Create index exports (AC: #2, #3)
+   - [ ] Create &#96;packages/shared/src/index.ts&#96;

+ ## Dev Notes

+ ### Architecture Patterns and Constraints
+ 
+ - **Shared Types Package**: Architecture specifies shared types package for contract-first development [Source: docs/architecture.md#Project-Structure]
+ - **Board Type**: Architecture mandates Board class as value object with BoardDTO for serialization [Source: docs/architecture.md#Data-Architecture]
+ - **Message Protocol**: Architecture defines WebSocket message types matching protocol specification [Source: docs/architecture.md#API-Contracts]
+ - **Type Guards**: Architecture recommends type guard functions for runtime type checking [Source: docs/architecture.md#Parallel-Development-Architecture]
+ 
+ ### Project Structure Notes
+ 
+ - Shared types package located at &#96;packages/shared/&#96;
+ - Types organized by domain: &#96;messages.ts&#96;, &#96;game.ts&#96;, &#96;errors.ts&#96;
+ - All types exported via &#96;index.ts&#96; for clean imports
+ - Package name follows workspace convention: &#96;@fusion-tic-tac-toe/shared&#96;

+ ### Testing Standards
+ 
+ - Unit tests for Board class: test all methods, validation, edge cases
+ - Unit tests for Move class: test constructor, validation, equals method

+ 
+ As a developer,

+ So that I can build the WebSocket server with dependency injection and clean architecture.

+ ### Architecture Patterns and Constraints
+ 
+ - **Jest Framework**: Architecture mandates Jest as testing framework with TypeScript support [Source: docs/architecture.md#Decision-Summary]
+ - **TDD Approach**: Development principles require TDD workflow with tests written first [Source: docs/sprint-planning.md#Development-Principles]
+ - **Coverage Targets**: Domain layer 100%, Application layer 90%+, Infrastructure layer 80%+ [Source: docs/sprint-planning.md#Development-Principles]
+ - **NestJS Testing**: NestJS provides testing utilities via &#96;@nestjs/testing&#96; [Source: docs/architecture.md#Technology-Stack-Details]
+ 
+ ### Project Structure Notes
+ 
+ - Each package has its own Jest configuration
+ - Root-level test script runs all package tests
+ - Test files follow naming convention: &#96;*.test.ts&#96; or &#96;*.spec.ts&#96;
+ - Coverage reports generated per package
+ 
+ ### Testing Standards
+ 
+ - Use AAA (Arrange-Act-Assert) pattern for test structure
+ - Test files can be longer than production code (up to 500 lines acceptable)
+ - Clear separation between Arrange, Act, Assert sections improves readability
+ - Coverage reporting helps ensure test quality
+ 
+ ### References
+ 
+ - [Source: docs/epics.md#Story-1.7-Testing-Framework-Configuration]
+ - [Source: docs/architecture.md#Decision-Summary]
+ - [Source: docs/sprint-planning.md#Development-Principles]
+ - [Source: docs/sprint-planning.md#Testing-Strategy-by-Layer]
+
